International Food Policy Research Institute

• Description: Strengthening national capacities and policies for food systems analysis and transformation in Kenya, Ghana and Senegal; Analytical and capacity support project in Senegal

• Outputs: Organization of learning event; Support to identification and co-development of training material; Contribution to research and evidence on Senegal’s food system

2.MCF (Market/Youth/PHL)

• Description: Knowledge generation related to drivers of food demand (cf. supermarkets, urbanization, consumer awareness) in food system development and transformation

• Outputs: Data checking/preparation/compilation of selected countries; support to evidence generation

• Description: Studying nexus of Fragility/Conflict/Migration in G5 Sahel countries based on secondary data in collaboration with WFP

• Outputs: Checking/preparation/compilation of WFP-M&E data and ENSA-like datasets for selected countries; support to evidence generation

6.WFP-Burundi

• Description: Assessment of contribution of the WFP project PATSAB to livelihoods and food security of smallholder farmers and school children in Burundi

• Outputs: Support to implementation of baseline study in targeted provinces (farmers and schools); support to evidence generation

Fragility, Conflict, and Migration Initiative

Strengthening National Capacities and Policies for Food Systems Analysis and Transformation in Kenya, Ghana, and Senegal

Agri-food system and policy landscaping in Niger

This proposal is to support the Niger Mission with an agri-food system and policy landscape analysis to better understand primary stakeholders, capacity gaps and the potential for various agri-food sectors to drive economic development in line with the following objectives:

  1. Mapping of Niger’s agri-food system
  1. Identify the major capacity gaps within the agricultural sector
  1. Provide recommendations for areas of potential growth that might serve as a driver for economic development, poverty reduction, and resilience to shocks
  1. Provide recommendations for how the capacity in the sector and business enabling environment might be improved

Projet d’Appui à la transformation des Systèmes agro-alimentaires au Burundi (PATSAB)

  • Objectif général :

Contribuer de manière durable à la réduction de la pauvreté, à travers l’augmentation des revenus des petits exploitants agricoles, et à l’amélioration de la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des populations vulnérables, surtout les petits exploitants agricoles et leurs communautés

  • Objectifs spécifiques

  1. Renforcer les capacités de production des petits producteurs (y compris pour la production d’aliments à haute valeur nutritive), en améliorant leur organisation et accès aux facteurs de production

  2. Soutenir l’intégration des petits producteurs aux marchés de demande structurée dans le pays à travers l’accès aux marchés structurés et rémunérateurs

  3. Renforcer les capacités des ménages agricoles à adopter des pratiques alimentaires et nutritionnelles saines

  • Résultats attendus / Effets attendus
